page.title: 20RHYL NEWSPAPERS
page.content:
The Rhyl Journal has been around since the 1840s but the Rhyl Visitor has only been in existence since 1983. Both papers give good news every week and have classified advertisements in them. The Visitor has 52 pages and is delivered free to houses in the area. The Journal has 24 pages and costs 22p. Both have their offices in Rhyl.
Pages on the Sun Centre, Clubs, Fire Station, Library, National Eisteddfod, and "Resurgam" were compiled by pupils of BRYN HEDYDD C.P. SCHOOL, RHYL.
Pages on the Holiday Resort, Shopping Precinct, Sports and Games, Promenade, Entertainments, Lifeboat, Eisteddfod Proclamation, Churches and Vicar were compiled by pupils of EMMANUEL C.P. SCHOOL, RHYL.
